means: 不确定，不能肯定或怀疑

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"怀疑"之意。
means: doubt ： 指对事物的真、假有怀疑。
supicion ： 语气较强，指对某人做某事的目的、意图有怀疑，或认为某人做错事，但无确凿证据而产生怀疑。
distrust ： 一般用词，泛指对某人某事不信任而感到怀疑。
uncertainty ： 侧重指对某事或选择等需作决定时的迟疑不决。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"怀疑"之意。
means: doubt ： 普通用词，多指因证据不足或仅凭证据还不能肯定而产生怀疑，多含否定意味。
suspect ： 指猜疑、疑心，肯定意味较多。
distrust ： 指疑惑、猜疑，不信任。

sentence.Network_en: There can be little doubt that he will offend again.
sentence.Network_cn: 毋庸置疑他还会再犯的。

sentence.Network_en: They have the usual quota of human weaknesses, no doubt.
sentence.Network_cn: 毫无疑问，他们身上也有人所共有的弱点。

sentence.Network_en: This new information does throw doubt on their choice.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个新信息确实使人们对他们的选择产生了怀疑。

lj.lj_ly: the outcome is no longer in doubt.
he was without doubt the very worst kind of reporter.
lj.lj_ls: 毋庸置疑他是那种最糟糕的记者。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French doute (noun), douter (verb), from Latin dubitare 'hesitate', from dubius 'doubtful' (see dubious)

entry.def: If you have doubt or doubts about something, you feel uncertain about it and do not know whether it is true or possible. If you say you have no doubt about it, you mean that you are certain it is true.

example.ex: This raises doubts about the point of advertising...
example.tran: 这对做广告的意义提出了疑问。

example.ex: I had my doubts when she started, but she's getting really good...
example.tran: 她刚开始做时我心存疑虑，但她真的做得很好。

entry.tran: 不能肯定;认为…未必可能
entry.def: If you doubt whether something is true or possible, you believe that it is probably not true or possible.

example.ex: Others doubted whether that would happen...
example.tran: 其他人认为那未必会发生。

example.ex: He doubted if he would learn anything new from Marie...
example.tran: 他认为他不太可能从玛丽那儿学到任何新东西。

entry.def: If you doubt something, you believe that it might not be true or genuine.

example.ex: No one doubted his ability...
example.tran: 没有人怀疑他的能力。

example.ex: Nobody that I spoke to doubted his sincerity as a politician.
example.tran: 和我谈过话的人中没有一个怀疑他作为一个政治家的诚意。

entry.tran: 怀疑，不相信（某人或某人的话）
entry.def: If you doubt someone or doubt their word, you think that they may not be telling the truth.

example.ex: No one directly involved with the case doubted him...
example.tran: 与此案直接相关的人中没有人怀疑他。

example.ex: I still have no reason to doubt his word.
example.tran: 我还是没有理由怀疑他的话。

entry.def: You say that something is beyond doubt or beyond reasonable doubt when you are certain that it is true and it cannot be contradicted or disproved.

example.ex: A referendum showed beyond doubt that voters wanted independence...
example.tran: 全民公决无疑显示选民支持独立。

example.ex: His ability is beyond any doubt.
example.tran: 他的能力毋庸置疑。

entry.def: If you are in doubt about something, you feel unsure or uncertain about it.

example.ex: He is in no doubt as to what is needed...
example.tran: 他很确定需要什么。

example.ex: When in doubt, call the doctor.
example.tran: 如有疑问，请联系医生。

entry.def: You say I doubt it as a response to a question or statement about something that you think is untrue or unlikely.

example.ex: 'Somebody would have seen her.' — 'I doubt it, not on Monday.'
example.tran: “可能有人见过她。”——“我认为不可能，不可能在星期一。”

entry.tran: 可疑的;不确定的;不可靠的
entry.def: If you say that something is in doubt or open to doubt, you consider it to be uncertain or unreliable.

example.ex: The outcome was still in doubt...
example.tran: 结果仍不确定。

example.ex: That claim is increasingly open to doubt.
example.tran: 那一说法越来越可疑。

entry.def: You use no doubt to emphasize that something seems certain or very likely to you.

example.ex: The contract for this will no doubt be widely advertised...
example.tran: 关于这个的合约无疑会受到广泛宣传。

example.ex: She's a very sweet woman, as you no doubt know by now.
example.tran: 她是一个非常温柔的女人，你现在肯定知道了。

entry.def: You use no doubt to indicate that you accept the truth of a particular point, but that you do not consider it is important or contradicts the rest of what you are saying.

example.ex: No doubt I'm biased, but it was the most cruel, evil human face I ever set eyes on...
example.tran: 我固然是有偏见的，但那是我所见到的最残忍、最邪恶的人。

example.ex: No doubt many will regard these as harsh words, but regrettably they are true.
example.tran: 固然会有很多人认为这些话过于刻薄，但是遗憾的是这些都是真话。

entry.def: If you say that something is true without doubt or without a doubt, you are emphasizing that it is definitely true.

example.ex: Without doubt this was the most important relationship I developed at college...
example.tran: 这无疑是我在大学时期建立的最重要的关系了。

example.ex: The refugees, without a doubt, are the most vulnerable.
example.tran: 难民无疑是最易受到伤害的。

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being unsure of something
2. uncertainty about the truth or factuality of existence of something;

sentences.sentence: "there is no question about the validity of the enterprise"

means.word_mean: 1. consider unlikely or have doubts about;

sentences.sentence: "I doubt that she will accept his proposal of marriage"

means.word_mean: 2. lack confidence in or have doubts about;

auth_sentence.content: I have no doubt Mr Obama means all this.
auth_sentence.res_content: I have no doubt Mr Obama means all this.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I have no doubt Mr Obama means all this.

auth_sentence.content: Caroline Wyatt says the result is in little doubt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Caroline Wyatt says the result is in little doubt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Caroline Wyatt says the result is in little doubt.

auth_sentence.content: Where there is doubt, may we bring faith.
auth_sentence.res_content: Where there is doubt, may we bring faith.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Where there is doubt, may we bring faith.

Sentence.sentence: Moreover, students should be prepared not just for their first job, but for their 4th and 5th jobs, as there's little reason to doubt that people entering the workforce today will be called upon to play many different roles over the course of their careers.
Most notoriously,Oprah's validation of jenny McCarthy's claim that vaccines cause autism(自闭症)has no doubt contributed to much harm through the foolish avoidance of vaccines.

President Obama will no doubt make the point publicly when he gets to Beijing: the Chinese need to consume more; they need-believe it or not-to become more like Americans, for the sake of the global economy.

sentences.en: There is no room for doubt.
There is not much doubt about his guilt.
sentences.cn: 他有罪几乎是可以确定的。

sentences.en: Everything is clear now; no one would doubt what to be done.
sentences.cn: 一切都很清楚, 没有人对所要做的事怀疑。

sentences.en: He doubts being able to finish in time.
They doubted his speeding up steps.
sentences.cn: 他们怀疑他是否能加快步伐。

sentences.en: We don't doubt that he can do a good job of it.
sentences.cn: 我们并不怀疑他能把这事做得很好。

sentences.en: Do you doubt what I say?
I doubt if it will rain today.
sentences.cn: 我不能确定今天是否会下雨。

sentences.en: I doubt it to be truth.
Nobody doubts him to have been honest.
sentences.cn: 没有人怀疑他曾经是诚实的。

jushi.chinese: 他们从心底里怀疑这些事实。

jushi.english: She did exactly what she had promised,I'm sorry I ever doubted her.
jushi.chinese: 她完全信守诺言,我对自己曾经怀疑过她而感到抱歉。

jushi.english: You can write to him if you doubt my words.
jushi.chinese: 要是你不信我说的话,可写信去问他。
